intro: Alloispermum integrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features lanceolate, entire leaves that are typically glabrous, giving it its common name. Its flowers are white to pale pink, with six petals and are arranged in umbels. Alloispermum integrifolium is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate climates.
